wikitext.*:
'''Tarmenel''' was a term that clearly translates as "high heaven", though as it only appears in one of [[Bilbo Baggins]]'s rhymes, it is hard to be sure exactly what the term referred to. In [[Elves|Elvish]] cosmology, the world was enfolded in different layers of airs, and it seems that Tarmenel was a term for the highest or outermost of these - the "[[Over-heaven]]".<ref name=":0">[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], [[Christopher Tolkien]] (ed.), "Guide to the Names in ''The Lord of the Rings''", published in ''[[A Tolkien Compass]]'' (edited by [[Jared Lobdell]])</ref>
==Etymology==
''Tarmenel'' is a [[Quenya]] name, described as signifying "true firmament",<ref>{{PE|17}}, pp. 19, 22</ref> apparently consisting of ''[[tar]]'' + ''[[menel]]''.
